Articles.Content:
Hi there!

In the past few months we've seen the forums grow, meaning that a lot more active members are now browsing, reading and posting. This is of course very exciting as it shows that KSP is reaching more and more people every day. More people posting also means more issues the Moderation Team has to deal with on a daily basis and we are therefore looking for 'fresh meat' to shape and train into well behaved and knowledgeable moderators. KSP Community Moderators have many tasks including Moderating the Forums, the IRC chats, the KSP TV channel, Wiki etc.

Due to the content that will be Moderated and a non-disclosure agreement, all candidate Moderators must be at least eighteen years of age. Additionally, all candidate moderators must have mastered the English language both in word and in writing. A final requirement is that you must be able to devote time to the KSP community on a regular basis.

Do you think you have what it takes? Then fill in the form below and we'll get back to you if we find your application meets our needs.

CLOSED

Thanks to everyone that applied! We will be reviewing and contacting people over the week. If you don't hear from us by next week, thanks but you'll have to try again next time.

Cheers!

James

Edited May 30, 2013 by Capt'n Skunky
Drive closed

Just to add to this, we are looking for moderators that can monitor the forums in the overnight US time hours. So anyone that has time when the western hemisphere is dark, your application will get a good look. We need moderators all around, I just want to get some from that time period to help the guys on that shift.

If you applied before this post, no worries, we will be looking at the timezones from the form so you won't be overlooked, no need to submit again.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
